Hi.
 The number notations, curiously enough, include tsuba and their signed
boxes if any. The irony was that things with a "Compton" name tended to
do well, where as it is the "Harvie" name that ought to have been the
clue to value after value. 
 Arnold 



>>> swords@... 07/16/05 12:16 PM >>>
Hi all - 

Not having the catalogue for Alan Harvie's tsuba (Sotheby's auction just
ended), I'm curious if lot 706 was a single tsuba or was that for
multiple tsuba. It appears to be a single, ex-Compton Kamakura-bori
tsuba but further down (on the internet listing) it mentions "quantity
2" which puzzles me. Pretty healthy price for a tsuba, if indeed one
tsuba. If so, would you say "provenance" played a big roll in achieving
this price?

Ron
STL
